description: Information required about your experiments to enable creation of a custom metadata spreadsheet.
name: template-questionnaire

technologyType.user_friendly: Did you use imaging and/or sequencing to generate your data?
technologyType.guidelines: This will add fields to describe the sequencing and/or imaging techniques that were used.

libraryPreparation.user_friendly: What type of sequencing library preparation technique did you use?
libraryPreparation.guidelines: This will add fields specific to the library preparation type.

identifyingOrganisms.user_friendly: What species are the donors of your experiment?
identifyingOrganisms.guidelines: This will add fields like ‘strain’ for mouse experiments and ‘medical history’ for human experiments.

donorsRelated.user_friendly: Are any of your donors related to one another?
donorsRelated.guidelines: 'Yes' will add fields to link related donors, e.g. a mother to her embryo.

preNatalQuantity.user_friendly: Are any of your samples from prenatal donors?
preNatalQuantity.guidelines: 'Yes' will include fields to record pre-birth age.

specimenType.user_friendly: What type of tissue sample did you use?
specimenType.guidelines: This determines whether tabs should be added to capture specific Organoid and Cell line information.

specimenPurchased.user_friendly: Did you purchase your tissue sample/s?
specimenPurchased.guidelines: 'Yes' will add fields for capturing purchasing information.

experimentInfo.user_friendly: Do you wish to record information about the where, when and who of your experiment?
experimentInfo.guidelines: 'Yes' will add fields to record the location, name/initials of the performer, and the date and time when each protocol was performed.

otherExperimentInfo.user_friendly: Do you have information about any of the following? Tick all that apply
otherExperimentInfo.guidelines: This will add extra tabs and fields related to each aspect to the template.git
enum: Information about preserved or stored tissue samples
Information about the condition of the tissue samples

protocols.user_friendly: Did you use any of the following protocols?
protocols.guidelines: This determines whether to add tabs to record information specific each protocol type.

timecourse.user_friendly: Did your experiment involve a timecourse?
timecourse.guidelines: Answering yes will add timecourse-specific fields to the template.

timecourseBiomaterialType.guidelines: This will add timecourse related fields to the selected biomaterial/s.

preservedTissue.user_friendly: Do you have information about the preservation and/or storage of the tissue sample/s?
preservedTissue.guidelines: Answering yes will add fields related to the preservation and storage of the tissue such as the type and duration of storage.

tissueState.user_friendly: Do you have information about the state of the tissue sample/s?
tissueState.guidelines: Answering yes will add fields related to the condition of the tissue at the time of collection such as ischemic temperature and descriptive text and images.

title: Generate a metadata spreadsheet
